executive_summary: The industry has exhibited strong growth in recent years as many consumers use the internet to seek love. The proliferation of broadband internet connections and the erosion of stigmas against online dating have helped the industry thrive. Furthermore, companies that are able to take advantage of rising smartphone adoption in the United States have been highly successful, with many companies offering services exclusively through mobile apps. Consumers are increasingly accessing the internet through their smartphones, enabling consumers to access online dating services at their convenience. As a result, overall industry revenue will grow at a CAGR of 6.1% to $3.6 billion over the past five years, with a 1.0% increase in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: As the digital age continues to permeate society, consumers' adoption of digital services has grown
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The percentage of business conducted online has grown meaning many activities that were once done solely in person have now been transferred online, boosting demand. The three largest companies in the industry all operate online or mobile platforms, if not a combination of both. Mobile dating apps have increased dating efficiency due to offering users a more on-the-go approach, compared with online websites where computers are the primary communication mode. Overall, online and mobile dating services make up a significant portion of the industry's revenue, with a combined total of more than 60.0%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Successful companies have remained competitive by keeping pace with digital advances
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consolidation has enabled these companies to keep up with shifting consumer and digital trends by acquiring companies that operate in niche markets. Match Group has been the leader in consolidation, purchasing full or partial stakes in Hinge and Ship and offering to acquire Bumble, all during the current period. Hinge and similar apps reflect the latest trends in the industry, including the concept of 'slow dating', which aims to address the issue of 'dating app fatigue' that many users have reported experiencing. In line with consolidation trends, the number of industry enterprises has decreased while employment has risen.

Particularly within the online and mobile dating segments, there was a flurry of activity amid stay-at-home and social distancing mandates. An increase in leisure time and social isolation led to a spike in online dating services usage despite uncertain economic, political and public health conditions. With heightened demand, companies added video call features and allowed users to include coronavirus-related dating preferences in their profiles. These new preferences have stuck in the market, with users reporting that virtual dates enhance the dating process by eliminating awkward first encounters.

The bulk of online dating service revenue is generated through upselling products and services on mobile applications. New premium features such as sending special compliments, super likes and different subscription tiers contribute to the industry's increasing revenue. Improved ad-based revenue models and targeted marketing strategies also helped improve industry revenue throughout 2024.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand launched by the COVID-19 pandemic will taper off for online dating services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The trend toward digital dating will stabilize as consumers have found video dates to be a safe and efficient way to screen potential partners. Demand for online dating may further expand as internet penetration continues to rise; mobile internet connections will increase in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Mobile dating will be boosted by rising mobile internet connections
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue from mobile dating will continue rising largely due to increases in the number of mobile internet connections. Companies will also increasingly incorporate location-based features as a value-added element to their mobile apps to facilitate in-person meetings between users. Such features will be trendy among users living in urban areas. Urban areas have a higher percentage of people with smartphones and a greater chance of facilitating in-person meetings with fellow dating app users.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulation is on the rise due to increasing consumer complaints of online scams and sexual predators
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New York, Illinois and New Jersey have already passed laws requiring online dating sites to disclose to users whether background checks are performed. In March 2021, Match Group announced that users would soon be able to perform background checks on potential dates. The addition of such features could potentially raise subscription fees among participating apps as companies pass the cost onto the customers. Mandatory background checks may never be enforced on online dating services, but companies that go to greater lengths to promote safe dating will gain a competitive advantage.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased substitutes and lacking innovation will cause demand to stagnate
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As a plethora of different niche websites enter the industry, consumers will have a larger pool of free applications to try out before actually committing to a subscription, this will cause industry revenue to stagnate as not enough.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide services facilitating clients meeting one another, usually with the intent of pursuing romantic relationships. Services can be provided via phone, internet, magazine and newspaper. The industry also includes companies that specialize in singles events, such as speed dating. It does not include social networking sites.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Demand has grown as the digital age continues to permeate society.
Mobile dating apps have increased dating efficiency due to offering users a more casual on-the-go approach.
Successful companies remain competitive by buying competitors
Many states have laws that protect consumers from fraud and deceptive business practices
Dating services are required to comply with federal and state data protection laws
Mobile dating is the largest and fastest-growing segment
Consumers aged 18 to 29 account for the largest portion industry's revenue
Companies locate themselves in large population regions, especially in the Southeast
Companies are set up in the West region due to large consumer markets
Competition is high as there are many small companies
External competition comes from social networking sites
This industry is highly fragmented and dominated by small companies
Match is the largest dating services company
The industry has seen a shift towards subscription-based models
Wage costs are rising with the popularity of mobile dating

market_segmentation.segment_description: Users in this age category are the most likely to own smartphones and use all available technologies, including online dating applications. These individuals also have the highest internet usage rates and are also more probable to use casual dating services aimed at mobile devices.

Users in this segment usually seek serious relationships using dating sites including Match and eHarmony. There are fewer individuals in this age category that have never been married, but this segment has grown with the overall divorce rate.

Consumers aged 50 and above have remained hesitant to put personal information online. Consumers aged over 50 using dating services are typically widowed or divorced. These users usually seek serious relationships and have fewer avenues to meet potential partners. This segment is deterred by privacy issues associated with online and mobile dating.
Consumers aged 65 and older have a smaller dating pool making the number of consumers seeking love in this category quite slim.

products_and_services.product_description: Mobile dating, as an extension of online dating, generates revenue through advertising viewed or subscriptions activated through mobile internet connections. In addition to online dating sites that offer smartphone applications, several new companies have entered the industry with mobile-only applications. A rapid increase in mobile internet connections over the past five years, including smartphones and tablets, has driven growth in this segment. Smartphones make online dating more casual and accessible, reducing the stigma associated with it. Mobile dating also allows for rapid messaging without needing to access a computer.

Matchmakers conduct in-person interviews with clients and select matches for them, usually from a smaller pool of candidates. The cost of matchmaking services varies greatly, with year-long contracts ranging from $150.00 to over $4,000. Due to the background checks performed by most matchmaking companies, some consumers consider them a safer alternative to online dating. The share of revenue from matchmaking companies has decreased in recent years as online dating has grown in popularity.

Online Dating Has Been Boosted By A Rise Of Niche Ethnic, Religious And Age-Based Dating Websites. This segment doesn't include social networking sites. Rather, it is made up of websites that are primarily focused on helping individuals form romantic relationships. Dating websites enable individuals to communicate not only through e-mail, but also through company-hosted video chat, voice chat and instant messaging. Free dating websites garner the majority of revenue through advertising, though these sites typically offer premium membership options as well. Demand for this segment has grown as online dating has become more socially acceptable among consumers.

This segment includes the hosting of events where single people can meet, including speed dating luncheons, happy hour and sports events. With speed dating, clients typically pay in advance, though some companies permit walk-ins. Individuals normally have three to eight minutes to converse with potential matches. Afterward, if both parties are interested, the company hosting the event will distribute contact information to the respective parties. Revenue from single events has also decreased due to the popularity of online dating.

tier_1_suppliers: Wireless Telecommunications Carriers in the US
Satellite Telecommunications Providers in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Database & Directory Publishing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Mobile dating applications account for more than one-third of industry revenue and their growth has rapidly outpaced that of other dating services. As more consumers connect to the internet via their mobile devices, demand for such applications rises. A rise in the number of mobile internet connections represents a potential opportunity for the industry.
The percentage of services conducted online measures how much consumers rely on the internet. As consumer internet usage has grown, online dating has become more popular.

Adults in the 20 to 64 age group are the key consumers of online dating and matchmaking services. As the number of consumers within this age range rises, demand for industry services is expected to grow.

A higher divorce rate indicates that more consumers are becoming single, increasing demand for dating and matchmaking services. Consumers are increasingly opting to postpone marriage to develop their careers and casually date more frequently, boosting demand for industry operators. As this rate increases, revenue for industry operators is expected to rise.

Per capita disposable income determines consumers' ability to purchase goods or services. With higher per capita income, more consumers will likely opt for subscription-based, for-pay and personalized industry services, expanding industry revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers use dating services during their leisure hours. As a result, demand for dating services declines when leisure time is limited. The less time consumers have for leisure, the less time they have available to consume industry services.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is home to the greatest share of industry establishments with Florida dominating this region.

The West region has the second-highest concentration of industry establishments. Establishments in the West are dominated by California as its home to large consumer markets in Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Diego. The West is also home to a large proportion of consumers under 44 years old, an age bracket that is the highest source of demand.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Some states require disclosure of safety info, criminal background screening policies.
Regulates sending of commercial emails, sets national standards.
Prohibits deceptive advertising, requires fee disclosure, no false membership claims.
Require refund/cancellation policies, protect against fraud and deception.
Some states require background checks on members for safety.
Regulate collection, storage, use of personal information. Clear policies required.
Some states require verifying member ages to prevent minors.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Labor requirements are moderate as most online dating sites can be managed with only one employee. However, the increasing need for specialized online developers and engineers makes labor for this industry somewhat specialized, which can serve as a barrier to entry.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is high as there are many small companies. The number of competitors in the industry is on the rise as barriers to entry are low and online dating is gaining popularity.
External competition comes from social networking sites. These sites are free, which can be another basis of competition for companies that only offer

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top three companies account for more than 40.0% of industry revenue with Match and eHarmony being the two largest companies.
The majority of companies are small nonemployers that focus on providing services to local markets.
Smaller companies typically have few labor requirements as it is they can service a large client base with only one or two employees.

As there is a myriad of different dating sites for consumers to choose from, larger companies are acquiring well-established dating sites and companies to increase the density of their consumer bases.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs depend on company size
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs include payments to partners distributing browser apps, hosting, technology expenses. Costs increase as website user numbers increase.
Companies exposed to insurance, legal fees, compensation, professional, administrative expenses. M&A activity leads to high auditing, legal, accounting fees.
Wage costs for programmers, database managers, marketing staff. Highly skilled staff required to build algorithms, improve user experiences.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Most sites can be managed with one employee, but need for specialized developers is a barrier.
Low rate of new patents and patent concentration creates low threat of technological disruption.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Economic downturns lead consumers to cut discretionary spending like dating services.

volatility_points.volatility_title: High competition leads to lower prices
volatility_points.volatility_description: Frequent new entrants and high competition in the industry leads to price wars impacting revenue.
Age, income of population impacts usage and revenue growth. Younger generations more inclined to use apps.
Positive attitudes towards online dating and relationships have boosted revenue recently.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Growth in ethnic, religious, age-based dating websites catering to specific segments.
Rapid increase in mobile internet connections driving growth of mobile dating apps and services.
Revenue from hosting single events like speed dating has decreased due to online dating popularity.

FAQs.question: Does your company provide a wide array of services or focus on one corner of the market?
FAQs.answer: Service providers that specialize in a niche may have a competitive edge, boosting sales volumes in that particular segment. However, should prices downturn, specialized providers will be more exposed to price risk since they are not diversified. Nonspecialized service providers will exhibit less revenue volatility and less price risk, should demand fall.

FAQs.question: Do your company's sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for dating services generally follows trends in per capita disposable income. As incomes rise, purchases of industry services become less of a burden. This trend has been challenged during the pandemic, whereby dating norms have changed significantly surrounding social distancing and stay-at-home orders, increasing demand for online and mobile dating.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in R&D to cater to consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Service providers that stay ahead of the curve in catering to shifting consumer preferences will reap the rewards of higher sales volumes. Quick adoption of the latest technologies will increase operational efficiencies, increasing profitability.

FAQs.question: How does your company provide access to services during periods of economic downturns?
FAQs.answer: While a large portion of industry services are carried out online, physical establishments that are in proximity to end markets will exhibit higher demand, such as matchmakers and singles events. Service providers that are not located in proximity to key end markets will find it difficult to attract consumers. During periods of economic downturns, digital services have had a competitive edge over in-person product segments.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to reduce wage costs by adopting technology?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs are low for this industry. However, they can be further reduced by adopting technology to automate administrative and bookkeeping work. Service providers that adopt the latest technologies will exhibit higher operating efficiencies, increasing profitability.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging geolocation dating app technology?
FAQs.answer: The gamification and utilization of geolocation dating apps is currently high growth, as shown by the activity of major players. Service providers that do not utilize geolocation dating services and apps are missing out on sales growth opportunities.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety standards are upheld?
FAQs.answer: Compliant service providers may receive a boost in public reputation, increasing the size of the userbase and boosting sales. Noncompliant service providers will be subject to higher insurance costs and premiums, hindering profitability. More recently there has been a push by advocacy groups for industry operators to take a larger role in protecting their users from potentially bad actors.

FAQs.question: Is your company prepared to meet shifting regulatory standards surrounding online profile verification?
FAQs.answer: - Compliant service providers may be favored by consumers due to increased transparency and security measures. Industry operators who make their users' safety a top priority will be favored by the market. - Noncompliant service providers will be subject to fines and penalties, reducing profitability.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare to those of its competitors?
FAQs.answer: - Large dating service providers with expansive userbases will exhibit lower costs per user, boosting profitability. - Margins vary with the size of the service provider, with new entrants often posting a short-term loss due to high marketing costs and costs associated with setting up a server and platform.

FAQs.question: What percentage of current customers renew service contracts?
FAQs.answer: - Dating service provider profit margins are dependent on the size of the userbase. Service providers with larger userbases will exhibit higher profitability. - Dating service providers must entice customers to renew paid contracts, to prevent them from substituting a competitor's product. - By offering subscription services, industry operators can exhibit more stable revenue growth.

FAQs.question: Which niches, if any, does your company cater to? How can it diversify its product mix?
FAQs.answer: Due to the high level of competition among most major industry services, the ability to develop niche markets is becoming more important. Such markets have been experiencing higher membership growth rates. For example, matchmakers have been pushing back against the gamified app techniques employed by Tinder or Plenty of Fish.

FAQs.question: How quickly can your company adopt new technology? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: Operators should have the ability to quickly adapt to new technology, particularly software enhancements that improve the search capabilities of the company's website. Overall, leveraging internet technologies to increase access to industry services has been a major boon for the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a strong reputation for reliability and performance among customers? Has it had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Having a good reputation and receiving positive word-of-mouth recommendations from clients is important given the high level of competition within the industry. People are sensitive about whom they share their personal data with and dating sites are no different. The reputation as a successful and safe enterprise will aid industry operators significantly.

FAQs.question: Does your company track the divorce rate? How will a decreasing divorce rate affect your company?
FAQs.answer: A higher divorce rate indicates that more consumers are becoming single, increasing demand for dating and matchmaking services. A declining divorce

FAQs.question: Does your company monitor trends for time spent on leisure and sports? How do these trends affect your company?
FAQs.answer: The less time consumers have for leisure, the less time they have available to consume industry services. Overall, without significant time to commit to dating, industry consumers will be less likely to find a match.

FAQs.question: Does your company keep track of trends in the number of mobile internet connections?
FAQs.answer: Mobile dating applications account for more than a third of industry revenue, and their growth has rapidly outpaced that of other dating services. More importantly, the wide access provided via smartphones has made online dating and mobile dating available to almost anyone, increasing the dating pool and chances of finding a match.
